item.title: Charlie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "You are a function of what the whole universe is doing in the same way that a wave is a function of what the whole ocean is doing." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Charlie add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking." -- George S. Patton

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures. Simple in actions and thoughts, you return to the source of being. Patient with both friends and enemies, you accord with the way things are. Compassionate toward yourself, you reconcile all beings in the world." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Charlie add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Gratitude is a sign of maturity...Where there is appreciation: there is also courtesy and concern for the rights and property of others." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Entreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: For wither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God." -- Anonymous

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "You shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free" -- Anonymous

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Things which matter most must never be at the mercy of things which matter least." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Charlie add a quote by W. Edwards Deming
item.description: "Experience by itself teaches nothing... Without theory, experience has no meaning. Without theory, one has no questions to ask. Hence, without theory, there is no learning." -- W. Edwards Deming

item.title: Charlie add a quote by W. Edwards Deming
item.description: "The worker is not the problem. The problem is at the top! Management!" -- W. Edwards Deming

item.title: Charlie add a quote by Carl Clausewitz
item.description: "In tactics the means are the fighting forces . . . the end is victory. The original means of strategy is victory -- that is, tactical success; its ends . . . are those objects which will lead directly to peace. Strategy . . . confers a special significance . . . on the engagement: it assigns a particular aim to it." -- Carl Clausewitz
